output_list.reason: The function 'mintCoins' has an integer overflow vulnerability. The addition of '_amount' to 'totalSupply' does not check if the result exceeds the maximum possible value of 'uint256', allowing a large '_amount' to overflow 'totalSupply' and be added to 'msg.sender' instead.

The function 'mint' has an integer overflow vulnerability. The addition of '_amount' to 'totalSupply' does not check if the result exceeds the maximum possible value of 'uint256', allowing a large '_amount' to overflow 'totalSupply' and be added to 'msg.sender' instead.
The function 'mint' allows the owner to mint an arbitrary amount of tokens at will, devaluing the token and causing financial loss to investors.

The function 'fallback' has an integer overflow vulnerability. The subtraction of 'msg.value' from 'this.balance' does not check if the result is less than zero, allowing a large 'msg.value' to underflow 'this.balance' and cause a denial of service.

The function 'mint' has an integer overflow vulnerability. The addition of '_amount' to 'totalSupply' does not check if the result exceeds the maximum possible value of 'uint256', allowing a large '_amount' to overflow 'totalSupply' and be added to 'msg.sender' instead.
